sentence.idiomatic: I have teaching qualifications.
Did you pass the qualification test?
I don’t think you’re qualified to say that.
He has a lot of experience.
Sometimes experience is very important.
You have no experience at all?
Communicating is very important.
I don’t know how to communicate with people.
Can you help us communicate (with them
This week we have training.
Did you attend the training?
You can only be employed after the training.
He doesn’t have this ability.

word.literal: to carry out well the duties of

sentence.idiomatic: I have the capability to be a good teacher.
You have to believe in your ability.
Your living conditions are pretty good.
Are you satisfied with the conditions offered by the company?
I can fulfill your requirements.
I've got a friend who wants to work in China. Is it easy to get a job here?
That depends on what he wants to do. But there are a lot of opportunities for teaching oral English.
Are there? Do you need teaching qualification and experience?
That will be the best. But it is not essential. Normally a university degree will do. The school will offer training.
Are there any other requirements?
Communication skills are very important in teaching oral English. Ideally, teachers should be sociable and personable, and good at motivating the students to participate.
Do you need to work full time?
Not always. Many schools now need part-time teachers.
What about the pay? Does the school take care of accommodation?
Expat teachers are quite well-paid. Some schools offer accommodation. But schools in big cities normally don't.
